events.name: Coding Girls Day!
events.description: CodingGirls Day!June 24, 2017 NTUC Auditorium, 1 Marina BoulevardClick here to RSVP: https://codinggirlsday.splashthat.com/ About the Event CodingGirls Day is our inaugural event where we bring female tech leaders, founders and enthusiasts in Southeast Asia together for a day of sharing, learning and networking. We aim to create an opportunity for women from all walks of life to get in touch with the tech community, connect them with leaders and show them the path to excel in tech career. Speaker Line up: Michelle Simmons, General Manager, Southeast Asia New Markets, Microsoft Asia Pacific Susan Jain, Chief Marketing Officer at IBM Sunita Kaur, Managing Director at Spotify Nopparat Yokubon, AUNZ/SEA Lead, App Developer Sales at Google Rosanna Ang, Lead Business Analyst at ThoughtWorks Virginia Cha, Adjunct Professor at Entrepreneurship INSEAD &NUS Anne Marie Droste, Managing Director at Entrepreneur First Lim Qing Ru, Co-founder at Zopim Anna V Haotanto, CEO & Founder at The New Savvy Bidushi Bhattacharya, CEO and Co-Founder, Astropreneurs HUB Pte Ltd Ayesha Khanna, CEO at ADDO AI Nathalie Ting, CTO & Founder at Upvise Beverly Dolor, Head of Engineering Spacemob Mrinalini Venkatachalam, Head of Public Awareness and Youth Initiatives at UN Women Singapore Committee Purnima Kamath, Director, Women Who Code Singapore Elisha Tan, Founder of Techladies Wan Ting Poh, ManagingDirector, Girls in Tech Singapore Arnaud Bonzom (Panel Moderator), Director of Corporate Innovation at 500 Startups Jenni Risku (Panel Moderator), Director and Founder at Venturem Steve Remington (Panel Moderator), Principal Consultant and Founder at Minerra Ann Luo (Panel Moderator), Co-Founder & Managing Director at CodingGirls SG Agenda 8:30am: Opening & Registration 9:00am: Welcome Speech 9:05am: Panel Discussion: Closing the Confidence Gap – Practical advice and where to begin 9:45am: Panel Discussion: Business has no Gender 10:25am: Panel Discussion: Coming Up Next: Technology you should Watch Out for 11:00am: Spotlight: Together We Can Make a Change – Female-led Initiatives Discussion 11:30am: All You Want to Know About My Techie Job 12:30pm: Lunch 14:00pm: Hands-On Breakout Session (Workshops) 1. Data Analytics for Beginners 2. Coding with Potato Pirates 3. Agile Development 101 4. Build Your Personal Website

events.name: Lab Induction
events.description:
The Lab Induction introduces you to the wonderful tools and housekeeping rules we have at the Community Lab. Each session runs from 9am - 12noon, on the last Saturday of every month.

Agenda:
1. Introduction to Community Lab@UWCSEA
2. Lab Tour
3. Hands-on demonstration of commonly used tools and machines + Quiz  
4. Sharing about how you can be involved

Sign up now at http://bit.ly/LabInduction
For enquiries, contact Melissa at 97970213 or email communitylab@sl2square.org
events.location: Community Lab at United World College SEA, 1 Tampines Street 73, #01-D119, Singapore 528704

events.name: TensorFlow and Deep Learning:  Beginners Day
events.description: DON'T RSVP HERE Please go to this link to signup here https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/tensorflow-and-deep-learning-beginners-day-tickets-35337551568?aff=meetup Beginners Day is here! We will be going through beginner level models and how they work.  The goal is to take you from nothing very little about Deep Learning to having an understanding about how it works and how to use it to build models for yourself. You need to have a decent understanding of code - specifically be able to follow along with code examples, and modify/enhance them on your own laptop.  That means you MUST BRING A LAPTOP (including power adapter). We will be using Python throughout the day.  If you are new to Python we suggest you watch this video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N4mEzFDjqtA We've put the MeetUp start time at 9:30am, as we have a lot to go through in the day. We've had to charge something for the event, because (a) we need to make sure people will come if they sign up; and (b) the location costs money.
events.location: Padang & Co, LEVEL3, #03-22/24, 20 Pasir Panjang Rd, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117439

events.name: Design Build Code : Hackathon for Kids
events.description:
Explore the Possibilities of Technology and Design
Join us for our inaugural kids' hackathon at National Design Centre! Spend a day with your loved ones and introduce your child to the wonders of technology and design. Our hackathon will feature three spaces for designing products/campaigns, building physical products and coding applications. This will be the perfect opportunity for your child to have hands-on experience with industry practitioners.
The hackathon will be a full day event with the following agenda:

Registration
Hackathon Kick-off and Problem Statement Introduction
Icebreaker and Grouping
Ideation and Brainstorming
Zone Exploration (Builder Space, Coder Space, and Designer Space)
Lunch (snacks and drinks provided)
Wireframing and Storyboarding
Product Building
Tea Time (snacks and drinks provided)
Group Presentations
Demo Time!


Please bring along a laptop. Recommended for kids age 10 to 12. No prior experience is needed, but if you or your child have any building, coding, or designing experience, you will definitely to be a great asset to the team.
*Do note that event details such as time and location are subject to change at the organizers' discretion.

FAQ
What is a hackathon?
A hackathon is an event that brings together programmers and others involved in software development to work on a solution collaboratively, often in a context of a competition.

What exactly will my child be doing?
There will be a problem statement that the kids will try to solve in this hackathon. They will be working in groups and each group will have members working in each of the spaces (builder, coder & designer). After working on their ideas, each group will then make a short presentation. 

Why should I bring my child attend this hackathon?
This is a great learning opportunity for your child to experience what an actual hackathon is like and have lots of fun in the meantime.

Is this hackathon suitable for beginners?
Absolutely! Imagination and resolve are the only qualities required. We will be providing coaching and mentoring to get your child started in each of the spaces to help them get started.

Is this a supervised event?
While there are facilitators around for most of the event, we would like parents to be a part of their child's learning journey. Parents are welcome to join in the coaching sessions.
events.location: National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, Singapore 188969

events.name: First Code Academy Demo Day (Jun 24)
events.description:
Dear parents and students, 
We hope you are having fun learning coding! It's time now for our traditional Demo Day event, where graduating students are invited to showcase and talk about their very own app creations!
At First Code, we strongly believe in the power of sharing knowledge and ideas - one of our classroom rules is "I love nice people who make cools things"! Our Demo Day is a wonderful platform for students to stand proud showcase their amazing projects to family and friends.
All students, parents and friends are invited to join our Demo Day this September. There will be showcase of custom projects from all our students, plus food and games for all!
 
Demo Day Event Details

Date: June 24, Saturday
Time: 10:00am - 12:00pm
Venue: First Code Academy, #04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

Hope to see you there and bring your friends and family! 
 
Note: Please register separate tickets for family/friends attending and for students presenting.
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at hellosg@firstcodeacademy.com
events.location: First Code Academy Singapore, #04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

events.name: Create and launch Your Own Android App
events.description: This is a group for anyone interested in creating your own android app without any knowledge on programming language. I started this group to meet other people wanting to create their own android app, for business, for prototyping, for hobby, for fun etc. I created some android apps absolutely ZERO cost without knowing a single line of programming language like JAVA. Looking forward to exploring the Android app development without the knowledge of programming language with everybody in the upcoming workshop. Sign up via the link: nocodingiot.com (http://www.nocodingiot.com) for the upcoming workshop.

events.name: #6 [Sat] Innovate through Design Thinking:Hands-on Workshop(Fundamental Course)
events.description: At its core, Design Thinking is a simple set of behaviours that can enable innovative results. Get guided at your tables by our design thinking facilitator Julee at the action-packed 'Innovate through Design Thinking: Hands-on Workshop (Part 1-Fundamental Course)'. In this 3 hours workshop you will learn the key Design Thinking behaviours - empathise, diverge+converge, and iterate. The knowledge and practice of the same will help you in unlocking the innovation potential of your teams. And its application, to solving your toughest business challenges. Highlights:^ Guest speakers for Ethnography Research & Business Design^ Design Thinking Toolkit & templates^ Free one slot of 1:1 consultation (30 min) Learning by doing. Expect it to feel different, expect it to be fast-paced.And, HAVE FUN! Book your seat now. Early bird discount and 20 slots available still!+ As we value your membership with Design Bootcamp Asia, you will get preference for the 1:1 Free 30 min consultation. Early Bird SGD 60 (Sold-out)Regular SGD 90Two persons SGD 160 Register and purchase your ticket here (https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/innovate-through-design-thinking-hands-on-workshop-fundamental-course-tickets-35072886949).  There's more! Continue your learning journey next with the upcoming. 'Innovate through Design Thinking: Hands-on Workshop (Part 2: Immersive Course)'. Where you can bring your own business challenges/ideas to reality and get guided in problem-solving through the basics learned in Part 1 fundamentals+Lean method. Watch out for this space for details or state your interest in the comments section.
events.location: Red Dot Ventures Incubation Office, Launchpad@one-north - Block 79 Ayer Rajar Crescent #04-03/04 , Singapore
